dsc.point_1: Laptop Galaxy, a React.js web app, showcases 200+ laptops from diverse 10+ brands, offering users an extensive selection.
dsc.point_2: The application fetches detailed specifications from a Firebase database, enhancing the browsing experience for users.
dsc.point_3: Explore detailed specifications of different models seamlessly and add favorites to a cart for convenient future reference.

dsc.point_1: Developed a dynamic portfolio using React to highlight skills, projects, and professional journey.
dsc.point_2: Firebase-managed contact info ensures reliability; quick links and responsive design enhance user experience.
dsc.point_3: Implemented quick links and responsive design for efficient navigation, ensuring a visually appealing and user-friendly experience.

dsc.point_1: Expense Tracker, a React.js tool, simplifies expense tracking for individuals and businesses.
dsc.point_2: Effortlessly monitor and control your finances with this intuitive financial management solution.
dsc.point_3: Built for simplicity, it ensures easy and efficient tracking of expenses, making financial management a breeze.

dsc.point_1: Student Management System built with Java Spring Boot facilitates seamless CRUD operations for efficient data management.
dsc.point_2: Utilizes an in-memory H2 database for efficient data storage and retrieval, ensuring optimal system performance.
dsc.point_3: Frontend, developed with JSP and JSTL, ensures a user-friendly experience, enhancing accessibility and usability.

dsc.point_1: Real-time chat application developed with Spring Boot and WebSocket technology enables live messaging over the web.
dsc.point_2: Backend, powered by Spring Boot, offers RESTful endpoints to manage WebSocket connections and message exchanges.
dsc.point_3: Seamlessly facilitates user engagement through live messaging with efficient backend architecture.
Allows librarians to effortlessly add new books, update existing records, and search by title or author.
dsc.point_2: Combines Spring Boot, H2 database, Hibernate, and JPA to enable efficient and easy management of book records.
dsc.point_1: Uses Kafka to provide instant notifications on inventory changes, ensuring up-to-date information for librarians.

dsc.point_3: Design a website like Zomato using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for a similar look and feel.
